result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th) and Operating w/ PAC (4th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th) was dismissed by the court.

  • John R Sellers was found guilty of OWI (4th), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
MCJ with huber for work and treatment if defendant qualifies under jail classification.
AMENDED- Allow huber for NA & AA if defendant qualifies under jail classification.
with credit for time administratively suspended.
Any vehicle titled or registered in the defendant's name is subject to IID for 36 months, as is the defendant himself. Half-priced IID ordered.

Case Called: 9:01 am 
State appears by ADA Sid Brubacher; Def appears in person, in custody with Atty Amanda Ley. 

DEF'S MOTION RE: COLLATERAL ATTACK. 
State makes statement. 
COURT makes findings. 
COURT grants motion as stated on the record. 

PLEA HEARING.   
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.
State moves to file amended criminal complaint. COURT grants. 
State moves to:
Ct. 2 (PAC 4th)>>DISMISS. 
COURT grants above. 
PLEA: Ct. 1 (Misd. OWI 4th)>>NO CONTEST. 
COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 
Atty Ley makes statement. Def makes statement. 
COURT ORDERS: $2605 inclusive with 60 days to pay or payment plan; 270 days MCJ with huber for work/treatment if def qualifies under jail criteria; Any vehicle titled or registered in the defendant's name is subject to IID for 36 months, as is the defendant himself; 36 months dl revocation with administrative credit; AODA. 
COURT finds the def is entitled to 92 days jail credit. 
COURT ORDERS half-priced IID. 
Atty Ley requests IID exemption for def's ex-wife's vehicle - his name is on the title - and notes she will submit written request. 
State to sign off on form for IID exemption.
